data.title: Free Buffet
data.text: Be sure to take advantage of this limited , special offer for Eldorado Players club Members.  You should see it on Your November mailer.  Always the best!  Fresh foods, made from scratch.  Pizzas,Pastas unequaled great selections daily.  And fun servers, too!  Best coffee ANYWHERE-PERIOD!!!

data.title: Best Buffet
data.text: This is one of my favorite buffets in Reno the food is always good. The first time my daughter and I ate there we ate so much we hardly ate for the next 2 days.

data.title: Good for family dining
data.text: All casino buffets seem to vary in quantity and quality from time to time.  Eldorado is no exception.  If we have a large group of family members in town it is a good place to take them and allows kids of all ages to be well fed.  Weekends can have long lines, especially during holidays.  Can be a bit pricey if you can't eat your money's worth.

data.title: Sure gone down hill fast
data.text: It was several years ago one of the best places to eat in Reno, We ate there last Sat. nite, one of the first in the door at 4pm when it opened for supper. The turkey was dry,steaks were so tough could not eat, the massed potatoes were lumpy. The fried chicken was so salty we could not eat. The food in their coffee shop which is open 24 hrs is far,  than better than this place. We could not eat half our food because it was either poor quality or just cooked poorly. The service staff were friendly. Safe your money try a good place to eat.

data.title: Best Buffet in Reno
data.text: I ate here with my folks during the Saturday night seafood buffet. Hands down, the best buffet we've ever had in Reno. The seafood was fresh and delicious, along with everything else at the buffet. I suggest you arrive within the first hour they open to avoid the crowds. Definitely try the peach Gelato for dessert!

data.title: Wrk & Fun
data.text:
We ck'd in to the Eldorado Hotel Friday night. Saturday evening when to the buffet they had a great variety of food
If you have room left the deserts are out of this world. Plus coffee is the topper!

data.title: Surprisingly Great Food --  lots of choices -- excellent BBQ and desserts
data.text: Great food and choices.  Great BBQ and desserts.  Plenty of choices for our whole family.  We enjoyed the pasta, ribs, brisket and bread pudding.

data.title: Great place!
data.text:
Great variety of food, nice servers and courteous, 
Always had plenty to drink thanks to servers were always on top for customer service.
 very clean restaurant

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F & B Coordinator at The Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your positive comments in regards to your dining experience. We work hard to offer exceptional food as well as outstanding service and I am elated to hear that you had such a wonderful experience. We hope that you truly did have a "five star" dining experience and would love to see you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great buffet
data.text: The food was great and the customer service was wonderful. The only bad thing was the veggies in the omelet were not cooked all the way but other then that it was great.

data.title: just an average buffet
data.text: good to get coffee, juice, fruit etc.  made to order omelettes, good pastries.  Service is great, glad we could use comps to pay.

data.title: What a Spread!
data.text: We are not into buffets but decided to go here since options for lunch were limited elsewhere.  This buffet exceeded my expectations and I will be back if I am ever in Reno again.  Salads, fruit, Italian, Mexican, Asian... and traditional mashed potatoes and meat.  Each station had such a variety of foods and I tried a bite of almost everything except pizza.  Everything was fresh and tasty.  Loved the chile relleno and the curry chicken with rice.  Spicy Italian pasta was yumm and so were all the cold salads.  Excellent staff and food make this place a must!

data.title: Still the best after all these years!
data.text: I've been going to The Buffet at the Eldorado for years now and it is still my favorite.  The staff are attentive and the food is better and seemingly fresher than any other buffet in town.  Getting back to the staff being attentive, it seemed like anytime my class got empty, someone seemed to appear as if by magic to refill my drink.  And the desserts!!  Save room for those!!  I know its hard to do at a buffett, but you will be glad you did.  The desserts are fantastic!!

data.title: Great low carb spot for lunch!
data.text:
Decided to try the Buffet in the El Dorado for lunch. I am on a low carb diet, so buffets in general can be difficult. 

I started out with their salad bar. Right off the bat I was happy because they had real bacon waiting there to accompany the salad I was preparing. 

Most of my meal consisted of the meat and barbeque at the carving station. In addition to roast beef, turkey, and ham at the station, they also had brisket, ribs, and two kinds of sausages as well.

The barbeque was delicious with just the seasoning put on it. The other meats were good as well. 

My drinks were kept filled and service was good too.

In addition to the low carb offerings, they had lots of Chinese food, a lot of great looking desserts, an omelet station, and lots of "comfort food" available as well.

data.title: Italian Festival
data.text: Wow! Their special Italian Buffet they serve during the Italian festival is amazing. They had it all! AND it was all outstanding. Loved the calamari, muscles, mushroom ravioli, and desserts the most.

data.title: Best in Reno
data.text: Wonderful variety and they aim to keep all the food fresh. With smaller portions put out you sometimes have to wait while they are refilling the tray but they make it up fresh so it is great.

data.title: Exceptional buffet
data.text: I confess that I am not a fan of buffets.  I don't usually find the food to be as fresh and the meat to be very tender.  But this buffet breaks my stereotype.  There was a wide range of foods to choose from, and I found the dishes to be delicious.  The one complaint I have is with the meats.  I found the prime rib to be tough.  But the one thing that truly stands out in this buffet is the desserts.  Not only are there plentiful choices, but the gellato was a very pleasant addition to the desserts.  Another plus of this buffet was the service.  Our waiter was constantly tending to our needs, and made our visit to be enjoyable.  This is one buffet that I will patronize regularly when in Reno.

data.title: Excellent Bar Seating
data.text: This outstanding buffet gets even better when you sit at their excellent granite counter bar with comfortable high back stools and multiple widescreens.  It's great to time your meal with a great sporting event.  When the cashier lines are long you can just signal to the bartender to set you a place before you enter and then go right in where you just pay directly to the bartender at the end of your meal.  Another advantage of sitting at the Eldorado Buffet bar is that you get a nice blast of refreshing air that streams down the entrance corridor which is really nice because the dining room of the buffet can get really stuffy.  The house merlot has that $100 bottle taste and comes directly from the winery owned by the owner of the Eldorado and they sell it for $20 a bottle.   Both of the bartenders have an outstanding relationship with their customers where they talk to you and make you feel special.   It's hard to sit down at a traditional buffet after this bar experience at the Eldorado Buffet.

data.title: $20 for Sunday Brunch - Not worth it
data.text: I took the bait and went to brunch.  The ad made this place out to be similar to the World Buffet at the Rio in Las Vegas.  The two are not comparable.  This place is a budget buffet of less than inspiring offerings.  It's a tires menu that likely could not compete with Home Town Buffet of The Golden Corral.  Very Average.

data.title: How can a breakfast go wrong?
data.text:
We wanted a no fuss no muss breakfast so in general a Sunday breakfast buffet should have been the right choice but at $21 per person at the Eldorado Buffet, we left feeling like we were cheated.  Sunday Breakfast Brunch buffets should be a big deal, laid with rows and rows of a restaurant's best breakfast.  This was worse than what you would get at a cafeteria.  The scramble eggs actually tasted as if it came out of a carton of yellow mustard color liquid.  At the carving station, the honey ham tasted as if the smoke was from an oven that was not cleaned, definitely not maple or honey flavor.  It was 9 am, and most of the items on the bar looked as if it was sitting out in the open for a few hours, or it was empty.

I opted for a veggie omelette but did not see spinach or zucchini so I grabbed some from the salad bar.  The cook gave me attitude and said he had spinach, so when I said I did not see it and didn't know, the plate full of vegetables outstretched for him to use, he didn't make a move to take the plate.  I got the impression he expected me to return the plate of vegetables to the salad bar.  Uhm, yeah, not so much.

This was the the worst Sunday breakfast brunch ever experienced.  Grabbing a breakfast burrito at a gas station would have been slightly better.

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F & B Coordinator at The Buffet, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to leave your comments in regards to your recent visit. We work hard to provide our guests with exceptional food as well as service and I want to apologize that your expectations were not met, as those are not the expectations we set for ourselves. I will be sure to pass your feedback on to our entire team as we are constantly using this to improve our services for our guests, such as yourself. We hope that you will give us another chance in the future to host you to a true "five star" dining experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Date & Review with my wife
data.text: We were going back and forth where we should eat tonight, circus circle or another buffet in the chain of casinos intertwined together...We wound up at the buffet in the Eldorado, it has very clean bathrooms that were immaculate, but what impressed me the most is the waiter we had, David is an awesome waiter, his Latin heritage showed through and his attention to details was amazing, his gracious demeanor made Cindy and I have a great dinner. Now to the food, if you are here in Reno on a Friday night it is Seafood Night in any casino with good Seafood that is unlimited it is between $25.00 dollars and up...I can tell you I sit here stuffed to the max, the Prime Rib was outstanding,  the turkey was really good, mashed potatoes they were real and totally awesome with the gravey n breads, the salad bar is a place to feast if you are not a meat eater...definitely a joy for us both to not have to cook and just enjoy each other...okay the tea...that's the Holy grail and congratulations to The buffet you are tops in Reno, Nevada and you made it to my top ten out of thousands of resturants I've been to in 35 years it was perfectly blended and refreshing in a full glass of ice...I was in Ice Tea heaven, 5 glasses...time now to roll outrageously outta here...my hat is off to management and excellent staff and beautiful food presentation... this is a must try...I would be surprised if you do not get the same treatment...
